gft.api
Interface Pricing

All Superinterfaces:
QuoteEventsProvider
All Known Subinterfaces:

public interface Pricing
extends QuoteEventsProvider

Provides access to the price-related functionality.

Boris Malkin

listCandleHistory

Candle[] listCandleHistory(int instrument_id,
                           Candle.Type type,
                           long from,
                           long to,
                           int max_count)
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Lists candle history.

Parameters:
instrument_id - id of instrument
type - candle type
from - start timepoint
to - end timepoint
max_count - max number of candles to return (there is also a limit on server side!)
Returns:
array of Candle objects
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - in case of remote errors

requestChart

byte[] requestChart(int instrumentId,
                    int timeframeCode,
                    int aggregateCode,
                    int width,
                    int height,
                    Indicator indicator)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
RequestChart request is used to render an aggregated chart as a GIF image on server side. The chart is built according to specified parameters: instrument ID, required timeframe (the period of time for each aggregate), and type of aggregate view (candlesticks or bars). The size of the GIF image is specified by width and height arguments passed in request. If the indicator argument contains an indicator object, the corresponding indicator is built over the chart. If the indicator parameter is a null value, no indicators are shown (a clear chart image is returned). The request returns a fixed-size GIF image stored as a sequence of bytes. Timeframe codes: 0 - 1 minute 1 - 5 minutes 6 - 30 minutes 12 - 1 hour 288 - 1 day 2016 - 1 week 8064 - 1 month Aggregate view type codes: 1 - candlesticks 2 - bars

Parameters:
instrumentId - instrument identifier
timeframeCode - chart timeframe code (see description above)
aggregateCode - aggregate view type code (see description above)
width - desired chart image width
height - desired chart image height
indicator - indicator to display on chart or null
Returns:
binary data â€“ a GIF image with the chart
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - in case of remote errors
